
my.getDataset = function(backend, urlOrLocationInfo, options, error, success) {
  if (typeof(backend) === 'string') {
    backend = backendFromString(backend);
  }
  if (!options) {
    options = {};
  }
  var out = backend.getDataset(urlOrLocationInfo, options, error, success)
  return out;
}

// ### _backendFromString(backendString)
//
// See backend argument to initialize for details
backendFromString = function(backendString) {
  var parts = backendString.split('.');
  // walk through the specified path xxx.yyy.zzz to get the final object which should be backend class
  var current = window;
  for(ii=0;ii<parts.length;ii++) {
    if (!current) {
      break;
    }
    current = current[parts[ii]];
  }
  if (current) {
    return new current();
  }

  // alternatively we just had a simple string
  var backend = null;
  if (recline && recline.Backend) {
    _.each(_.keys(recline.Backend), function(name) {
      if (name.toLowerCase() === backendString.toLowerCase()) {
        backend = recline.Backend[name];
      }
    });
  }
  return backend;
}
